All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, Realism, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class DisarmingSim
extends SimBox

A simulation with multiple detonators that can be moved around. The simulation is designed such that if the detonators are pushed to the boundaries of the simulation space, they will be removed from the simulation ("disarmed"), otherwise they will explode. This simulation also demonstrates the technique to allow the simulation itself to respond during execution. All previous SimBox classes were only an interface to the simulation engine. (See actionPerformed method for details)

Since:
5.1
See Also:
Serialized Form

public DisarmingSim()

DisarmingSim

public DisarmingSim(boolean isRandom)
Creates new DisarmingSim with at most three detonators.

Parameters:
isRandom - true if the detonators should be placed randomly in the simulation.

DisarmingSim

public DisarmingSim(boolean isRandom,
                    int detCount)
Creates a new DisarmingSim with the specified number of detonators.

Parameters:
isRandom - true if the detonators should be placed randomly.
detCount - The number of detonators to place (more than three could prevent simulation from being able to place them all.
